website_summaries.verdict: Super affordable, but limited to screen doors or windows. Installation instructions call for higher placement in screen, so pets should be able to jump comfortably.
pros: Magnets hold flap in place to reduce drafts
cons: Can only be installed in screen doors or windows, not wooden or metal doors
Opening is less than 8 by 10 inches, suitable for pets under 30 pounds only
Locks with small plastic pins that can break

customer_reviews.title: Works great but needs one small modification.
customer_reviews.text: This door works great and is easy for the dogs to use. Installation is very easy. Cut the screen, and press the inner and outer frames in place with the door in place .Included instructions are easy to follow. However, the door needs a small modification, at least for some dogs. One of our dogs tends to charge through the door, causing the outer frame to pop off. After putting it back together 3 or 4 times, I drilled 6 holes around the frame and added nuts and bolts to keep the frame from coming apart. No problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This door has worked out well for our 21 pound havanese. He fits through it just fine. He loves it and learned how to use it within a day or two with some practice with treats. My husband did reinforce it with four nuts and bolts (one in each corner) as recommended by other users. It was pretty easy to install. We've had it over a month now and our dog uses it constantly throughout the day to go out on the deck and we've had no problems with it. Great deal for the price! The only problem will be when it gets cold and the slider needs to be kept closed...puppy is getting spoiled with this freedom!
customer_reviews.author: C. Roy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of opening and closing the door for my yorkie. If I left it open flies found their way in. I purchased this pet screen door hoping it would help and I couldn't be more delighted. Works perfectly for my little dog and it was easy to install. Once I taught her how to use it, I can now simply open the screen door and let her come and go as she pleased! Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: MD ain't bad

customer_reviews.title: Pro tip: Use spline to install.
customer_reviews.text: I tried following the directions but it doesn't attach well to the screen. There are no screw holes in the top or bottom, just the corners and sides and the tabs don't hold it in place. This causes the screen to sag. I thought about using silicone like the directions suggested but had a better idea. I attached the screen to the grooves using spline like you would a screen door. I rolled the spline in the outer most groove. It's now very sturdy with no sagging. They should make this part of there design.
customer_reviews.author: The Barth's

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We headed two extra screws, one top middle and one bottom middle to add sturdiness. Our little 9 lb. 13 yr. old blind guy goes through nice and easy. Our 17 lb. 4 yr. old power house goes through like an exploding torpedo (thus the extra screws) and our 48 lb. guy goes through like a gentleman, though sometimes like a drunk one! We’ve only had the door for a few months but it is holding up fine. I definitely recommend this door.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Thorning

customer_reviews.title: Good door for the price but you'll need to modify it a bit
customer_reviews.text: Good door for the price but the two halves just snap together without any kind of true locking or securing method and they started to come apart within 2 days of light use. I just got some small bolts, drilled holes at the corners and on each long edge, and then used the bolts to keep the two halves together. The hinge and door itself are holding up excellently.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew LeBaron

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it, he is a yorkie poo so those does are not that powerful to break anything. Well I guess I was wrong I don't know how it broke but it did. The side door connectors to the frame that sways the door are plastic not metal, so I I guess that was how it broke. Update the company was able to help out and send a new one. Hopefully the are smart to use metal tabs instead of plastic ones that is attached to the weakest spot of the door. Makes sense so they don't have to send new ones to other buyers like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Blinkit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Screen Doggie Door!
customer_reviews.text: We finally installed this screen doggie door and it’s perfect! We were a little afraid of make a hole in the screen but glad we did it. Not sure if this is how the directions were written up but we basically screwed it in place, clear caulked around the outside (both inside and outside the screen) and then the next day we trimmed the inside of the door with a utility knife. A couple of treats later and Theodore has no problem going through it without our guidance. Thinking of buying another and installing on the other side of the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Javier & Annaliet

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you plan to do extra work
customer_reviews.text: Garbage as is but functional with modifications. My 7lb dog had this door come with him after about a week of use. Left a lovely hole in the screen. With original set up you can see that it doesn’t seal properly. Occasionally will set itself into lock mode - perhaps catching on a tail? Either way it’s very frustrating for the dogs. How we made it work: extra screws for more spots on the frame and lots of glue in between those spots. Additionally taping down the lock switch is a help. Would not buy again but it is technically useable and it’s cheap- so I guess it has that going for it?
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality... Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Great potential but poor quality. This door is the perfect size for my three large dogs. Assembly was easy although the two pieces did not snap together as I expected. The locking feature never worked but I didn’t buy it for that so I was not bothered. The build quality however is very poor. The door cracked after a short time. I repaired it with tape and that held for a few days until the section broke off. I will now be looking for a more reliable replacement. This product may be good if you have small dogs that don’t use it very often but I would not buy if you plan on using it often.
customer_reviews.author: Recreational golfer

customer_reviews.title: Good if you're willing to add screws to secure it
customer_reviews.text: From reading other reviews, I was prepared to add screws if necessary to secure it. It would not have held on my screen with just the press fit, so I drilled five holes (four corners plus the center top) and used 1/2" #6 machine screws with nuts to hold everything together. The 1/2" screws are just long enough to hold but not protrude so there's nothing sharp for the cats to hurt themselves on. The door itself is a good size, and the lock, though not terribly sturdy, is enough to stop my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Leia1979

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy install. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats. All of which know how to open cabinet doors, turn on light switches, move pillows, blankets and cushions, specifically knock stuff off of tables and shelves, take things and relocated them to other places. Yet Somehow they all seem befuddled by this simple swinging mini door. This is a great product and so easy to install. It works great. I’ve been bribing my cats with treats to come on and out of it, seems to be working. So far I just prop it open because WTH, they’re cats.
customer_reviews.author: K.L.H.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Boy was I sceptical about this product. I have this screen door that I like but it was easily replaceable so I went ahead and installed and it worked. ( I had to work on getting the top to stay closed but finally got it tight). Now the hard part was getting my two older (14yrs) jack russells to use the door. It took a few days but finally with many biscuits he goes in and out at will. That's Jack. Now Heidi doesn't really like the door. She rarely uses it to go out but once outside she uses it to come in.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, even with our wacky installation
customer_reviews.text: So -we didn't feel like taking the screen door off. We installed it while the patio door was standing in place, cut the hole using the pet screen as a template...used hand pressure to connect it. (We tried using a block of wood with a light hammer - eh.) took the dog 2-3 days to get it...but it worked perfectly. (Every few days, the pet screen door would come off if she was running too hard into it (or if we had tried to close the patio door while the pet screen was still swinging) - Resolved this by using a hot glue gun and gluing the halves together. Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: M Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: It's a piece of sh!t. Don't bother wasting your money. This is the second one I've tried and it's crap as well. The design is flawed and not easily installed. Hubby is an Engineer and he had a terrible time getting it installed...it broke into pieces and he had to glue it in. Looks absolutely nothing like the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine B.

customer_reviews.title: 5 minute install.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy install... took me a good 5 (maybe 7) minutes to install by myself and I’m 7 months pregnant. Took the door off, laid it on the ground, put one part with the grooves under the screen, cut out the screen on the line, placed the other part on top “locking” it in, put the door back on. So far so good. Just hope the cats catch on soon verses still trying to claw a hole in the corner of the strewn door, smh. I’m training them with treats.
customer_reviews.author: Jenee

customer_reviews.title: Not the best design
customer_reviews.text: Works good with some modifications. Unit is in two pieces. An outside frame and an inside frame. They are supposed to snap together and sandwich the screen in between the two halves. The way it snaps together doesn’t hold at all. No screws to fasten the two half’s together. I added a bead of silicone sealer between the two halves and clamped them together until dry and that seemed to hold them. But the puppies love to use it and it’s surprising durable.
customer_reviews.author: whardman

customer_reviews.title: This pet door has been great for us - the cats caught on to it ...
customer_reviews.text: This pet door has been great for us - the cats caught on to it very quickly (though one doesn't love to use it, she will). I appreciate that you can lock it when you don't want them to use it. Complaint: the way the 2 sides attach together does not work great and it will separate and you have to put it back on (over and over). It would have been nice to have some "pins" that would pierce the screen and snap on to the other half to keep it together better. Initial installation was easy, but realigning when it comes apart is a bit trickier.
customer_reviews.author: KMEMN

customer_reviews.title: Horrible - do not buy! A screen cannot support a pet door.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. I know it sounds like a great idea, but it just doesn’t work. You cannot effectively hang a pet door from screen. And if it gets bumped whatsoever when the pet goes through, it’s not going to stay up very long. I have the door tied up so that it doesn’t swing in and out because the whole thing is just too fragile to take that kind of movement. I wanted to like it but from the moment I started installing it I knew it was not going to be a happy ending.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Happy dogs, house free of bugs
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, this product is fairly easy to install and seems sturdy enough, after reinforcing it with nuts and bolts. It took our dogs about a week to figure out how to use it, and now they're coming and going like pros! What I wanted to point out was an unexpected benefit of this pet door: NO BUGS in the house! Previously we would leave the back door open in nice weather so that the dogs could enter and leave the house without our having to open the door each time. But then the house would fill up with flies, mosquitoes, and other insects, which we'd have to kill later. Now the house is blissfully bug free!!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to assemble this door, and now there's a hole in my screen door. This product depends on snapping together via two channels of plastic. These had no guidelines for installation and would not snap together on my screen, even while using a rubber mallet. The plastic is flimsy and cheap, and the "lock" is two small plastic pegs that can't even engage when the two plastic halves aren't together. Absolutely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B. King

customer_reviews.title: Large is NOT for up to 100 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Large door for my 70 lb Labrador retriever. Before installation, I put it up next to him and realized how small it was, I honestly can’t see how any dog larger than 50 lbs would fit through this door. Photo and description are misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this dog door is expected for something that is installed into a mesh sliding door. Make sure you really tighten the screws, and that your overall screen is in good condition. Instead of totally cutting the inner frame I left it to hang over the door to ensure bugs didn't get in throw the small side spaces. We also put our door closer to the left side of the door. I think putting it dead center would permit too much give to the screen. Our dog has used this for over a month and he has loved it. Making sure its the right height is paramount!
customer_reviews.author: Krieg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: The cat quickly learned how to use it with the aid of some tuna! We put the tuna on the opposite side of the window she was on and made her pass through to get it, we helped her at first. The last piece of tuna was inside the window while she was outside. She was stubborn about coming in without help, but we just left her there, and eventually she came in and got her prize! Next day she's already used it several times with no help! No more worries about if the cat is in or out! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: WeN

customer_reviews.title: Easy it insert
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to insert into the screen. Great for my kitties. They took to it pretty quick. My older cats tried to jump over it an hit in the screen the first time. I cover the screen around the door with fabric until they got used to wear the door was located. I think this happen because my screen is black. I believe it was hard to tell where the door was. I just pinned fabric onto the screen all around the door. Removed the fabric after a week. They have no problems now.
customer_reviews.author: LTC J.A. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Easy.
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install. However, it really never did snap together. I bought the larger one because it’s screws, even though I have an 18 pound dog. I knew it would be stronger having the screws. Thank goodness I bought that one because I basically had to screw it and then try and snap it and even after it’s totally installed the snap parts are not really snapped together. Also, I don’t think flies can get through the edges, but I think mosquitoes might be able to? We will see how long it lasts???
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Add Brackets - Nice and sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: The product is decent. The frame is solid. If you install the product as described in the directions your screen will quickly come undone as the screen is not strong enough to hold the door in place when your pet runs thru it. I have a medium size dog, and it is used often. I removed the doggy door, re-screened my door, and re-installed the doggy door with the opening closer to the lower corner of the screen door. I also added 'L' brackets (See picture) and now the screen is great, the doggy door works great, and all is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Here's how to install
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that come with this pet door are whack; imma gonna make your life easer: 1. Tape main unit (with the swinging door) outside of door, on the screen just where you want it. Use packing tape or something that will hold it temporarily. 2. Go inside, grab your exacto knife, and cut the screen along the A or B groove (A for metal screens. B for vinyl screens) 3. Snap backing piece onto the main unit; you'll need to apply pressure (I used pliers to make sure it was secure) That's it. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: General Mayhem

customer_reviews.title: Not good for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: This door worked good for a week then the screen came out on the PetSafe frame, I have a german shepard and this thing just did Not hold up, now I have to spend a lot of money to have the whole door rescreened, they need to do a better job on design for larger dogs, I bought a Large hoping it would work longer than a week , but it did not. I think this thing would hold up for a cat or small dog, but not a big dod like I have.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: This was PURRfect!
customer_reviews.text: We built an outdoor catio for our cats to be able to safely sit outside when the weather is nice and we wanted a good way for them to go in and out of the window. Short of just cutting a hole, this was exactly what we were looking for! Has a slight magnetic closure at the bottom so it will sorta "lock" into place. The locks on the side are nice, we don't use them, we just close the window when its time for them to come inside. They love it and learned how to use it quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Skeffington

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste you money
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install, however, I have a small Yorkie. He would use the door faithfully, however, it kept popping apart no matter how many times I pounded it together. The locks on it also kept automatically locking so when Theo would try to use the door, he would break the screen because one side was locked. So I fixed the screen and even broke the lock pieces off, but the frame keeps popping apart. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Connie C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality with some Issues.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because its a nice, simple, pet door. Installation is easy, but even after ensuring everything was fitted together the door would still being to come apart after a couple of uses. I ended up hot-gluing the inside where the two sides meet to keep it holding. The other issue is that after a pet walks through the door, the swinging motion of the door flap actually forces one of the side locks to pop out so the door ends up locking itself. I'm not the most popular owner when I get home and my pets have been locked outside all day.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: PetSafe Pet Screen Door
customer_reviews.text: Built a catio off one of the bedroom windows for my 3 cats. I put this in the screen window, but did take the advice of other customers and added a few small bolts since there are 3 cats using this all day long. I also took 3m window shrink plastic and covered the screen including the pet door then I don't have to worry as much about the cold or hot weather coming through the window
customer_reviews.author: R. Lipke

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It does the job of allowing my dog to come in and out with the main screen door shut. However I found that getting it together nicely is hard, I don't know why they used long plastic bumps thinking that was a good way to get a good hold on the screen. It only came with 6 screws. I think a thicker frame, and pin-like plastic all over the inside on each side would've been a better way to get sturdiness. I wish they put more thought into how it connected to the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect doggy door for sliding screen door.
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install. Definitely add some caulking if you have any to reinforce the screws. Either way, great product. Ensure you measure your animals belly to ensure that he/she does not run into the bottom opening. The only thing i will say is that once you cut into the screen, you lose some of the tension. Do not hesitate, and continue to cut as directed.
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: My cats get in and out easily. The screen is low quality and not as durable as my window screen. Would have rated it higher had the screen not get ruined after less than a day of use. The locking mechanism is just a tab that is pushed out on both corners. It tends to lock or unlock if your pet decides to push on it at the corners which becomes frustrating for both animal and human.
customer_reviews.author: Jster

customer_reviews.title: The tabs keep breaking.
customer_reviews.text: This screen doggy door is great except for the fact the small plastic tabs keep breaking. This is my 4th or 5th one and I am done replacing it. I will buy a different brand today. There are 2 small plastic tabs that hold and swing the door. It takes a few months and the tabs break making the door a hole in the screen. The tabs are too small to glue or fix. It is unfortunate because I love this style and size.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 20 years. Best for Buck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same exact item. The last item lasted many years. I think we got our cats just after 9-11. Man oh man, replacing the screen is a pain in the ass! Next time I'm going to see if the hardware store will do it. I'd gladly pay what the unit costs to have someone else install it. But good longevity. 20 years? Yeah I'm all good.
customer_reviews.author: impendingaff

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install, make sure you have the flap lock on correct side
customer_reviews.text: The product does what it's advertised. The large door is the perfect size for my 3 shih tzu dogs. When installing, make sure to have the locking mechanism face the same direction as your screen door handle/lock. Installed in 10 minutes and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Nav

customer_reviews.title: No more scratching at the door!
customer_reviews.text: Actually replaced another door that was smaller so used the same hole in the door, just had to cut a bit bigger. I liked how it had screws to hold the sections together, something I had to add to the other one or it would fall out. Dogs learned quickly with a couple of dog treats on either side. Now we don't have to let them out all the time- as long as the weather is good!
customer_reviews.author: senior22006

customer_reviews.title: Teaching your cat is the hardest part
customer_reviews.text: Adding the 4 bolts is a really good idea when assembling. I also used a couple of clamps after the door was reinstalled on the track to squeeze the two halves together. These are the dewalt squeeze handle clamps with rubber tips. If your screen is a little shreaded at the corner from kitty trying to get in, assume you will have to rescreen the door first. As for the cat, mouse cat toy pulled through the flap helps. 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice door that really works but get creative with install.
customer_reviews.text: Great small dog door, took off stars for the install as other reviewers have commented as well, it needs a re-design to have teeth or pieces that protrude through the screen that click and lock into the frame outer edges, would be a simple fix on their part. Also the locking piece on one side kept locking on its own - weird I know - so I just put a tiny piece of tape on it to keep it from sliding to lock position.
customer_reviews.author: tee

customer_reviews.title: Good but has a few kinks
customer_reviews.text: The door itself works very well. Ours is right in our screen enclosure and has already come loose on one side. Like other reviewers, we screwed this down on all four corners or it will pop apart. Not sure how to keep the Screen from pulling out of the frame but some rigging is now in order before it falls all the way out. I still like it just have to work out the kinks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy door
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for two years now. Works great in our screen door so the cat and dogs can go out into the fenced yard when they want in nice weather without letting the bugs in. After reading other reviews, we drilled holes in the corners and added small screws and attached nuts to keep it together because it kept falling off. We have pet screen on our patio door which is quite thick.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Answer to a big issue!
customer_reviews.text: This screen door is the perfect answer to my long-time issues with my cats. My cats constantly come to my bedroom window to get in and out - at all hours of the night! I would get up, open the screen and let them in so yes, that was my fault. With this screen door, which I installed VERY quickly and easily, they now come and go as they please!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Krazy

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to install and works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first doggie door I have installed. We needed one for a sliding door. I was hesitant about installing a door in the mesh screen, as I was not certain if the setup would be sturdy enough, but I am pleased to report that the screen material is providing enough support to this lightweight solution. We have had it now for a week and all is well. I am very happy with this purchase, and so is our dog!
customer_reviews.author: Wouter

customer_reviews.title: Pops off too easily and lock broke
customer_reviews.text: Had to drill holes and bolt the plates together to keep our dogs from knocking it loose at least once a week. Good in a pinch, but save up your money and buy a sliding door insert, which is what we ended up doing. Note: tab for locking the flap was chewed off by our puppy within days of installation.
customer_reviews.author: Mavelo

customer_reviews.title: Reinforce the rest of your screen when you put this door on
customer_reviews.text: The screen worked great, but the cat freaked out one night and pulled on the door. I had to replace the rest of the screen door with the toughest screen and haven't had any issues since. I would recommend replacing your stock screen before installing this pet door. This does not mean the pet door is defective or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Judas

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I put it in the window screen so my cat has access into her catio. I love that she only has access when the window is open. It is a little flimsy in the screen but it works because she’s not bolting outside as some dogs may do. If this was for my large dogs, I’m not sure how it would hold up. Works great for the cat though! She caught on quickly too!
customer_reviews.author: Allison D

customer_reviews.title: Cut my dog!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this pet door! The edges are very sharp and after a few weeks of use, my dog has a few cuts from brushing against the locks/edge when going in and out. Absolutely AWFUL design. This is something that literally needs to rub against your pet for it to work, so the edges should be smoother and of a softer material. I would never recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 cats. Assembly was easy but directions could be improved. Cats won't go through it tho as it seems they have a hard time seeing 'the door'. Its flimsy on the screen. Wish i hadn't put it in but the heavy duty screen is too hard to redo. It wouldnt handle a pet who goes through without precision movement.
customer_reviews.author: beary

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good product as long as your dog is mannerly
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good product as long as your dog is mannerly. It will not take a super tough beating, so train your dogs, and watch them for a few days to make sure they are not pawing at it trying to figure it out. Duh, I think you know where I'm headed here. My one dog who "knows" how to use a doggie door wanted in the house but the slider was closed in back of the screen. He worked so hard at trying to get in that he ripped out the doggie door from the screen. Fortunately I was able to put the door back in, but about 30 more seconds and it would all have been trashed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Koehring

customer_reviews.title: Way too small for big dog
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my dog. I have a 70 lb goldendoodle. I ordered the largest size that says dogs up to 100 lbs but that just seems very unlikely. It’s more for a 30-40 pound dog. Our dog tried to go through and the door came off and our screen ripped. If it was bigger I think it’d be a good product- the magnets worked well, it just isn’t big enough.
customer_reviews.author: K. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A great way to keep the bugs out while your pets have easy access through the door.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze. You have to take the door out to do it, but not a big deal. Just place one side of the door under the screen and trim with a razor around the inside track. Then snap the other side on and you are good to go. Our cat is having issues remembering it is a door. Occasionally if there is enough motivation he will figure it out, but we usually have to push him through it. I don't know if that is normal or not. He used a similar door in our last house, but it was kind of different. Anyway, it works exactly like it should and I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: OCDetails

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: First of all, installation was difficult. The plastic pieces have to be squeezed together with the screen I'm between, which is next to impossible. Even using tools, I could only squeeze the bottom and sides together. My door only lasted a week before one of my cats ripped it and the screen can't be replaced. After 3 weeks of use, my cats knocked the whole petsafe door off and I have given up on it. I'm going to order a different brand and fingers crossed it will work better.
customer_reviews.author: Mardi

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This screen door for our cat came in very handy, it helps to keep out all the flies that once plagued our home after our cat would leave our screen door open after she would go in and out the house to the backyard. For a more secure fit on the thick pet proof screen door screen I used some clear silicone which helped big time. I have the screen for 5 months already and its working great.
customer_reviews.author: larhonda325

customer_reviews.title: Installation instructions: Do not follow the ones that come with it.
customer_reviews.text: The directions say to use a marker pen to outline the cutting of the screen and to use a rubber mallet to "snap" the two pieces together. First, a marker pencil does not work because you are marking a dark screen. I used a white crayon type pencil. The rubber mallet does not work. I broke one of the hinge pins. If I were to do the installation again, I would use the rubber mallet. Instead of hammering on the metal insert directly, I would you a narrow piece of wood to hammer on the insert. Would I buy this unit again, yes? Would I follow the installation instructions as written, no?
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bidleman

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have this installed in our sliding screen door for our 19 pound Mainecoon cat Spike. After a few days of cat treats to teach him he could go in and out on his own he does. When I first saw the door I didn't think it was large enough for him but then realized it is perfect for him. I highly recommend this door.
customer_reviews.author: Honeybee

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for window screen cat door
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way for my cat to get in and out of my apartment. It was super easy to install the small one in a window screen. It took her a few days to learn how to use it, and now it's a total breeze for her, even with the blinds down. It's nice that there's a locking option. I've had it about 3 months with no problems. I didn't add any extra hardware, just used a rubber mallet to install and double checked all the seals were good before I put the screen back up.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy J. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. The instructions said to put silicone caulk in four corners prior to seating the front and back together. I did that but added two more beads of silicone on each of the four sides. I don’t see the need to drill and put nuts and bolts in the four corners as some suggest. My two cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and sturdy for use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this super easy to install doggy door! I did not even take the door off like the instructions say to do. I had my husband help hold it on, I screwed it together enough, cut out the door portion, and then tightened the screws. Our Weimaraner puppy loves this (largest size) doggy door. Our friend’s full grown German Shepard followed her through it and back out- it was sturdy and handy. Now we just need to figure out how all of the sticks keep ending up on our living room rug 😉
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great. BUT
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. BUT, I had to drill 6 holes, and add bolts to pull the thing together to get it to smash fit the screen. I didn't install it in a screen door, so there wasn't the option to remove and lay down to beat it together. I don't think it would stay snapped together without the added bolts. I gave it 4 stars for this reason. Pet Safe should review this design and add the bolts, Then I'd happily give 5 stars. My dog loves it, I just like it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great door
customer_reviews.text: This door was a replacement for the original one that lasted 3 years but was broken when my cat ran through it to get back in the house during a sudden thunderstorm, while it was locked. No fault of the door. We bought the exact door again. One thing I read on the reviews was that people had to supplement the installation with screws in the corners. I didn't have that problem because my screen is aluminum wire and not fiberglass fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco 431

customer_reviews.title: Functional and tough
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd PetSafe pet door in the past 11 years. Mine get a lot of use by my indecisive dog. It works great. To install it you sandwich the patio screen between the front and back frames and press them together. All three of my doors have separated over time so now I drill them out and fasten the front and back using pop rivets. This may be a little much for some owners, but I had the rivets and gun so it was no problem. Anyway, you might want to plan to screw the front and back together with maybe #8 screws & nuts and a 3/16" pilot hole.
customer_reviews.author: Boidle

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect..?
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write reviews often but this door for dog or cat is almost perfect. If you install as instructed it will come apart easily sooner or later due to it not having screws to bind it together securely. So I ended up doing just that by using a screw for each corner. It’s now perfect and secured. Now my dog can go in and out without knocking it off easily. Highly recommended way to do when installing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Danny K

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised with this door. Installed easily and works as it should. The older cats adjusted to it in only a day. The younger one has his own unique way of using it. My only issue is the gap between the door and frame is large enough to permit insects to get in. I placed narrow strips of thick, fluffy Velcro along the edge of the frame so that just the fibers touch the swinging door. Kind of like a door sweep. Seems to keep out the insects and the door swings freely.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog door!
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a place to cut a large dog door into the wall. My husband didn't want one of those panels in the glass sliding door. This was a very inexpensive alternative, for $25 we thought it was worth a try. So far it works well, we are pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terri A.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for pups to go in and out
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install. We have two smaller sized dogs, 8 and 15 pounds that with some encouragement at the start have figured out how to use the door when they want to get out into the back yard. With us being home most of the time it works well as we’re fine with having the screen sliding door only.
customer_reviews.author: HwnSkye

customer_reviews.title: Good idea decent build quality
customer_reviews.text: works however sis not snap shut the scres provided where smaller the the seats so would not screw shut. Screen was aluminum so it did not snap together. Door is slightly heavier than anticipated. It works. However I would not necessarily recommend the large size to people.
customer_reviews.author: Werking reviews

customer_reviews.title: which worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Okay for a small dog, maybe, but not if your small dog is a corgi or anything larger. I ordered this thinking my dog could still fit through it being close to the size limit, but I could not install this low enough to the ground for him to be able to just walk through it, and it was not tall enough for him to jump through. I'd also had issues getting the door set up in the first place, and it fell off a few times before I just had to give up and return it. I orderedas an alternative, which worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Steffel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This door serves its purpose as described. I have mine attached to the sheet metal instead of the screen. Not really designed for this but holds up well when reinforced with 3/4" #10-24 nuts, bolts and washers. Requires a little more work and tools like a grinder and drill but it is where I wanted it to be. My dogs run in and out of it pretty fast and the door is holding up pretty well, it is plastic construction so there is a chance the hinge will break over time. No big deal - at this price I would order another one
customer_reviews.author: N. Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! The screen door is very slim
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ! The screen door is very slim, light, just great. Extremely easy to install, no need to remove the screen panel either. Just use tape to mark the outlines, place any hard surface on the opposite side and use an exato to cut then pliers with something soft in between the metal so you don't scuff the plastic frame and press the two parts together. There is a small gap that is easily fixed by taping some foam strips and then the only thing left is hope that the your cat will actually manage to learn to use it!:)
customer_reviews.author: Maneto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a metal patio door
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our metal patio door. Husband used 4 screws to attach it the door. Could of maybe used a little bit bigger door size for my 14 pound dog, but she fits thru.
customer_reviews.author: MsW

customer_reviews.title: Light duty only?
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive for a reason. Not very heavy and won't tolerate much abuse. Two Jack Russell Terriers love it but almost are more than it can handle. One of the locks broke off the first day even though we were not using them. Will likely work for a a season but will probably replace it for next year. *Update* - door suffered a critical failure at 11 weeks. the metal pin the door is hinged on broke, rendering it useless. two 10lb Jack Russell Terriers - 1; PetSafe Pet Door - 0. Replacement shopping now . . .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doggie dog
customer_reviews.text: Very very disappointed this did not even last a month.this is a replacement from one we purchased several years ago. The screen part that swings when the dogs thru. The hinges are plastic and that is what broke. Might add we have 2 small dogs each less then 25 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Gerry S

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, and was much cheaper online than in my local pet store. However, the frame just snaps onto the existing screen and is easily dislodged by rambunctious use of the doggy door. When the plastic frame pops off, we have to take the whole screen door off and pound the plastic frame back on with a rubber mallet. This has happened twice since I purchased this 5 weeks ago. Also, the screen in the doggy door is regular mesh, and easily destroyed by puppy claws. Would be better it is was a metal mesh, but that would most likely increase the cost.
customer_reviews.author: SunnySD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to get the dog used to it.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our needs. I did the install a little different than the instructions said. I just put it in place, screwed it together, and the. Cut the screen out around the inside edge. Worked perfect! I recommend you follow the instructions if you can, but I could not.
customer_reviews.author: CPO

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Dogie door did the trick. It works well. The only downside is it hangs on the screen and pulls on it. Someone suggesting hot glue for the sides. We installed it and once our dog figured it out. She had pulled some of the side out so when we fixed it, we hot glued the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as staff, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Works. Magnet that holds it shut is a bit stiff, so it took our cats a while to learn to use it. When they're motivated to get out or in, they use it. If we're around they try to convince us to open it for them. If you have staff, why not use them?
customer_reviews.author: El Mac III

customer_reviews.title: A good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This door works great. Very easy to install and that’s coming from someone who is very non-handy. My only problem with the door is that sometimes it locks on its own and then my cats are stuck in or out. The other problem unrelated to the door is that one of my cats doesn’t understand that it can’t always be unlocked for him and he nearly tore the door down trying to get out when I locked it one night so he couldn’t go out.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Weinreb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution for cats
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and the cat has no problem using it regularly. Minor issue is that the device will pull apart from the screen after significant usage, but hopefully the addition of the adhesive suggested by the instructions will solve that with this model. (This is a replacement to a previous one the broke while trying to re-clamp the device to the screen.)
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Northern VA

customer_reviews.title: definitely need to add some sort of fastener to the ...
customer_reviews.text: definitely need to add some sort of fastener to the screen so it does not pop apart - one dog loves it - the other is scared of it....reason being is when the screen closes, it vibrates back and forth with the magnets to come to closure, this has frightened our dog and we cant get her to get past it now....i wish there was a way to remove the magnets but they appear to be molded into the plastic....
customer_reviews.author: Dana Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Above the rest!
customer_reviews.text: This pet door is far superior to others I've used. The picture does not do it justice. It is well constructed with easy install. The color is a very well saturated brown which matches the brown color of most newer windows. Thanks for carrying this screen!
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Confusing set up, but does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions and had a bit of a hard time to set it up, however tweaking it here and there made it useable and definitely allows the dogs to go out while also keeping the door closed to keep bugs out. Worth the money for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Once I made a few modifications the door worked great. Similar to other customers I had an issue ...
customer_reviews.text: Once I made a few modifications the door worked great. Similar to other customers I had an issue with the unit coming apart. I removed the door twice and snapped the sides back together only to have them come apart. One customer suggested to drill use small screws and nuts to hold it together. WORK PERFECTLY. Once you do this I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Benshell

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for a 75 lb. dog
customer_reviews.text: The description is wrong. I have a 75 lbs lab mix and this door is wayyyy to small for her to fit through. I also have a French bulldog/ Boston mix and it fits him perfectly. He’s 35lbs. If your dog is more the 40 lbs, I would not purchase this door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This little screen door works like a charm. I was concerned that it might be too flimsy since it went into the screen but it works fine. It took about 15 minutes to put it in. We have a cat and a small dog that both use it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lee

customer_reviews.title: This cat flap works great.
customer_reviews.text: Our cats have yet to figure it out, but I think they're just being stubborn. The one tip I would share is to make sure your screen is tight before you install it. Ours was a bit loose and the door wobbles a bit, but otherwise it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Roy D. Lubkeman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. It was exactly what I needed. No one believed in my ancient chihuahua’s ability to learn to use it but he proved everyone wrong. It was easy to install, doesn’t look tacky, and seems very sturdy. I love the lock feature too. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Emma H.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and designed. Ok with modification.
customer_reviews.text: The snap and lock mechanism designed on this does not work very well. It easily gets undone when it gets bumped by my dog. I've seen other reviews manually modify theirs with drilling holes and screws to fix this , but I wish the manufacturer just made it that way from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Noel G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Mounted the door with four bolts and nuts over metal frame of the screen door. Its very important to mount the door at the right height for your pet. The bottom of the 'door should be roughly at the bottom of your pet's body, so the animal can just step through. My door has worked perfectly for my 20# mini Australian shepherd for about 6 months. Today I found the door on the ground, one of the hinge pins just sheared off. The construction materials are really flimsy, but for $12 I'm buying another one to replace.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Frame is plastic but with Pet Screen screening- the two sections will not go together or stay together. Apparently the large dog door has screws to keep it together and the small one doesn't. While trying to attach the two pieces with a rubber mallet, the swinging door hinge broke. Get what you pay for I guess. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Gerbracht

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick to install. My husky loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! I actually installed it on my window after my husky tore the screen because he loves looking outside. Haha my husky is 76lbs, i def don’t believe the size would be big enough for him to completely fit through, but I’ll update this if it happens!
customer_reviews.author: Astrid De la Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works great for my cats. Love that I can set the lock to only allow ingress or egress. The door is pretty sturdy and is probably as sturdy as the window screen itself. The lock pins seem like they will be the first thing to break if they ever do, but doesn't seem like an issue considering the price. I've had mine for about 4 months now and have not had any problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: heartofgarlic

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I have had many Petsafe products. This was the easiest to install by far. I did not install it in the screen door but instead in the screen panel. I will be adding L brackets to ensure that the door is secure and sturdy so it doesn't rip the screen. So far, I am happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ann Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Not made for active dogs
customer_reviews.text: Not made to last- I knew it was too good to be true. Maybe if your dog is small and slowly walks out the door it would hold up but my dog tends to run and chase squirrels, birds and lawn men. Have reinstalled three different times but no longer can...too worn out. Nothing beats the professional work spend the money and not deal with the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L.

customer_reviews.title: Broke before even instaling
customer_reviews.text: The hinge pins are plastic, and one broke just holding the thing up to look at it. Cant imagine they would hold up well to a dog going in and out
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Me

customer_reviews.title: my cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my pussy cat. That pussy really likes the freedom it gives her. In and out and in an out. as she pleases. and let me tell you she is one pleased Pussy cat with this purchase. oh and the dogs use it also.
customer_reviews.author: Steven the Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the market for another screen pet door since this one was destroyed during a storm and I remembered how difficult this one was to install! It did not want to clasp together and I ended up having to put screws all the way around the frame to hold it together. Once that was done it worked ok, except the lock feature can be easily disengaged. Sometimes my 5lb Yorkie would bump it just right and cause the lock to disengage.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't kid yourself, you're gonna need heavy-duty glue and lots of binder clips...
customer_reviews.text: OK, seriously poor design! There is NO way anyone will simply be hammering this together and then wah-la- it's ready to go. We ended up jerry rigging the entire contraption. It took E6000 glue and about 12+ binder clips.... glues the two sides together with the screen in between... clipped it tight, and left it over night, and we got LUCKY! It's functioning. However, it's only been 2 days, so we'll see how long it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: CK

product_meta.title: PetSafe Pet Screen Door - Dog and Cat Door for Screen Door, Window and Porch Use
product_meta.description: Size:SmallLet your pets out and the breeze in. The PetSafe Pet Screen Door gives your cats and dogs freedom to go in or out without asking for your help to open the door—perfect for potty breaks or play time. The high-impact plastic frame surrounds a durable mesh that is puncture and tear-resistant to stand up to frequent use from multiple pets. The door snaps directly into your existing screen door, window or porch screen for quick and easy installation, and blends perfectly with your existing screen. Works with most metal or vinyl coated fiber screens on storm doors, windows and porches. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet LIVE HAPPY TOGETHER.
feature_bullets: ENCOURAGE EXERCISE AND INDEPENDENCE: Give your cats and dogs freedom to go in or out without asking for your help to open the door—perfect for potty breaks or play time
EASY TO INSTALL: Snaps directly into your existing screen door, window or porch screen for quick and easy installation, and blends perfectly with your existing screen
BUILT TO LAST: The high-impact plastic frame surrounds a durable mesh that is puncture and tear-resistant to withstand frequent use from your pets
SAFE AND SECURE: Large door has sliding wind-locks that are strong enough to resist flapping open in the breeze but not so secure that your dog can’t run through; small door locks to prevent entry
DIMENSIONS: For pets under 30 pounds; flap opening size is 8 inch W x 9 1/4 inch H; measure your pet to ensure comfortable use
SIZE INFORMATION: For cats and small dogs under 30 lb; the small flap opening size is 8 in W x 9 1/4 in H; measure your pet to ensure comfortable use
CUSTOMER CARE: Let our pet product experts help; we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274
QUALITY GUARANTEED: PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years; we help pets and their people live happy together

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
